title: FAW Trophy
text:
The FAW Welsh Trophy is a knock-out <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition contested annually by teams from <a href="Wales">Wales</a> and the borders.
The <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Wales">Football Association of Wales</a> is the organising body of this competition, which has been run every year since its inception in <a href="1890%E2%80%9391%20Welsh%20Amateur%20Cup">1890–91</a> (except during the two World Wars) for clubs competing in the lower echelons of the <a href="Welsh%20football%20league%20system">Welsh football league system</a>.
It was known as the Welsh Junior Cup until 1902, when it became the Welsh Amateur Cup, a title it held until 1974, when it was renamed the FAW Intermediate Cup. The competition took its current title in 1993.
Eligible clubs.
In order to play in this competition a club must compete at Level 3 or below of the Welsh football league system.
Teams playing in and below <a href="Welsh%20Football%20League">Welsh Football League</a> Division 2, the <a href="Mid%20Wales%20Football%20League">Mid Wales Football League</a>, the <a href="Welsh%20Alliance%20League">Welsh Alliance League</a> and <a href="Welsh%20National%20League%20%28Wrexham%20Area%29">Welsh National League (Wrexham Area)</a> are eligible to enter.
All applying clubs must also meet the Competition Ground Criteria requirements.
Winners from outside Wales.
Just like the <a href="Welsh%20Cup">Welsh Cup</a>, the FAW Trophy was once open to clubs from the Marches and an English club took the trophy out of Wales on nine occasions:
